items.title: Raccoons Disrupt Airbus Assembly Line
items.summary:
- *Raccoons* broke into an Airbus plant near Montreal, causing a temporary halt in production.
- They climbed landing gear and caused damage, including *chewed wiring* inside the jet.
- Airbus captured and relocated the animals and now has measures in place to prevent future intrusions.

items.title: Sprinter Marking Inc. Overview
items.summary:
*Sprinter Marking provides ink code-marking machines that apply date, logo, and symbols on various materials.*
- Their machines can mark up to 4 square inches at 300 cycles per minute with quick-drying ink.
- Known for being compact, durable, and cost-effective, their systems have been industry staples since the 1970s, with US-made models and inks from Ohio.

**Tags:** industrial marking, code marking, manufacturing, equipment, ink technologies

items.title: STANLEY Engineered Fastening
items.summary:
- *Stanley Engineered Fastening* is a global leader in fastening solutions, trusted for over a century in various industries.
- Their *Assembly Technologies* brand offers precision tools with features like *real-time error-proofing* and *full traceability*.
- The company emphasizes *performance, flexibility,* and *cost-effectiveness* to help manufacturers improve quality and reduce costs.

items.title: ADAS Technology Increases Complexity of Assembly
Researchers Help Robots Solve Complex Assembly Problems
Improved Indoor Air Climate Can Boost Productivity
American Airlines Takes Delivery of First A321XLR
items.summary:
- American Airlines has received its first Airbus A321XLR, designed to enhance long-haul services. 
- The aircraft is grounded due to ongoing *seat supply chain issues*, unrelated to tariffs on European-built jets. 
- American plans to expand its long-haul fleet significantly by 2029, but similar challenges are affecting other airlines like Delta as well.

items.title: Manufacturers Win, and Lose, With OBBBA
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)

items.title: Virtual Reality Helps Stellantis Improve Assembly
items.summary:
- Stellantis employs *virtual reality* to enhance assembly line efficiency and safety.
- Their advanced VR lab enables engineers to simulate workstations, optimize layouts, and address potential issues before production.
- This technology helps to *improve ergonomics* and reduce risks by fine-tuning assembly processes in a realistic virtual environment.

items.title: Rinco Ultrasonics
items.summary:
- Rinco Ultrasonics sets the *standard* for ultrasonic welding and cutting technology, emphasizing *Swiss quality*. 
- Their advanced servo and pneumatic machines prioritize *traceability* and meet ISO13485 certification, catering to the *medical device industry*. 
- RincoUSA offers *application studies* and fast delivery of high-quality ultrasonic tooling to resolve production challenges.

items.title: New Research Initiative to Spur U.S. Manufacturing Technology
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- The *National Science Foundation (NSF)* is investing **$25.5 million** to enhance U.S. manufacturing innovation. 
- The initiative supports **seven research grants** and **nine seed projects** across 36 institutions, aiming to address critical technical gaps. 
- Key areas include *artificial intelligence*, *robotics*, and *biologically based manufacturing*, preparing a skilled workforce for advanced manufacturing leadership.

items.title: Ametek Acquires Faro Technologies
items.summary:
- *Ametek Inc.* has acquired *Faro Technologies Inc.*, a leader in 3D measurement technology.
- This acquisition enhances Ametek's capabilities in *precision measurement* and allows entry into new market segments.
- Faro joins Ametek's **Ultra Precision Technologies Division**, expanding its portfolio in metrology and digital reality.

items.title: Yaskawa to Build Robot Factory in Wisconsin
items.summary:
- Yaskawa America Inc. is constructing a new factory in *Franklin, WI* to manufacture industrial robots domestically.
- This facility will streamline production, improve supply chains, and consolidate multiple operations into an *800,000 square feet* campus.
- The investment highlights Yaskawa's dedication to *localized production* and innovation in the robotics industry.

items.title: New Center to Study Digital Twin Use in Manufacturing
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- The *Center for Digital Twins in Manufacturing* aims to enhance performance and efficiency in manufacturing.
- Challenges include *standardization* and integration of digital twins across systems.
- Research will also focus on *human-robot collaboration* and reducing uncertainty in digital twins.

items.title: Arctic Automates Appliance Assembly
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- *Arctic SA*, Romania's leading appliance manufacturer, exemplifies automation with over 200 robots at its Ulmi factory.
- The state-of-the-art facility has reduced energy and water consumption by **17% and 25%**, respectively, while achieving **100% automated quality control**.
- Recognized as a *Lighthouse Factory* by the World Economic Forum, Arctic's innovations enhance productivity and product quality, setting a benchmark for the industry.

items.title: New Technology Speeds Up Robotic Inspection
items.author: Jennifer Pierce
items.summary:
- Techman Robot has introduced *flying-trigger technology* for automated inspection, reducing the need for parts to pause under cameras.
- This innovation allows for *continuous, high-speed* inspection with real-time analysis, significantly improving efficiency.
- Techman claims that their technology can cut inspection time by *40 to 50 percent*.

items.title: ACE Controls Inc.
items.summary:
- ACE Controls has over *60 years* of expertise in industrial motion control.
- They provide **innovative solutions** like shock absorbers and gas springs aimed at boosting efficiency and safety.
- ACE is a trusted partner for engineers seeking *quality*, *speed*, and robust support across various applications.

items.title: Rhino Tool House
items.summary:
- *Rhino Tool House* provides comprehensive manufacturing solutions to companies across America.
- Their offerings include **assembly tools**, **material handling equipment**, and advanced **manufacturing technologies**.
- They aim to improve productivity, quality, and workplace safety for their partners.

items.title: Promess Inc.
items.summary:
- *Promess Inc.* specializes in advanced sensing and motion control systems for manufacturing and testing.  
- With a heritage of over 40 years, they offer **high-precision** solutions that enhance quality and efficiency.  
- Their tailored systems tackle complex manufacturing challenges while fostering *real-time* monitoring and control.

items.title: Pro-Line
items.summary:
- Pro-Line, founded in 1978, is a *leader in ergonomic workbench design*.  
- Their workbenches are known for their *high quality* and *modularity*, enhancing productivity.  
- Customers can easily customize their workstations using a *3D configurator* or by selecting from preconfigured options.

items.title: PI Expands U.S. Operations with New Facility
items.summary:
- *PI* is opening a new **140,000 sq ft factory** in Shrewsbury, MA to enhance local support and innovation.
- The facility will produce **advanced technologies** like gantry robots and piezo nanopositioning systems.
- This move will enable faster customer access and help mitigate **import tariffs** and supply chain risks.

items.title: Performance Feeders Inc.
items.summary:
- *Performance Feeders Inc.* has been designing automation feeding equipment since 1973. 
- Their products include various feeders like Vibratory Bowl, Centrifugal, and Flex Feeders, among others. 
- The company employs advanced technologies like robotics and 3D printing for custom solutions, enhancing *production efficiency* in multiple industries.

items.title: Motion Index Drives
items.summary:
- Motion Index Drives specializes in *high precision rotary index tables* and *precision cam indexing machines*.  
- Their offerings include *weld positioning systems*, *robot transfer units*, and customizable rotary indexers.  
- They prioritize *safety*, *quality*, and *versatility* to ensure long-lasting performance and reliability.

items.title: Makita USA Inc.
items.summary:
- Makita leads in *cordless precision fastening* for assembly environments. 
- With over *100 years of experience*, their tools offer trusted torque and energy savings. 
- Makita provides ergonomic, safe tools with wireless communication for effective fastenings.

items.title: Kolver North America LLC
items.summary:
- Kolver has excelled in *precision fastening solutions* for over 35 years, providing electric screwdriving systems to 50+ countries. 
- Their product offerings include *screw presenters*, *torque testers*, and various accessories to cater to diverse industrial needs. 
- Kolver's systems offer *low installation and maintenance costs*, along with decreased vibration and noise, making them ideal for assembly processes.

items.title: Infotech Automation Inc.
items.summary:
- **Infotech Automation** specializes in multifunctional *dispensing and assembly machines*.
- They offer high-accuracy positioning systems tailored to specific needs, enhancing *precision processes* in various settings.
- Their commitment to *precision, reliability,* and *flexibility* is strengthened by partnerships with customers and suppliers.

items.title: Industrial Profile Systems
items.summary:
- **IPS designs modular aluminum framing systems** that adapt, move, and evolve.
- Their systems streamline assembly, reduce downtime, and scale effortlessly, allowing manufacturers to **build smarter**.
- With engineered-to-order capabilities and in-house support, IPS ensures that structures don't become a **bottleneck** in the manufacturing process.

items.title: Software Error-Proofs Assembly of Medical Training Equipment
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- Laerdal Medical implements *Tulip Vision* for error-proof assembly of training equipment. 
- The system ensures completeness and accuracy in *kitting and assembly*, eliminating defects. 
- Continuous data monitoring through *machine learning* leads to significant efficiency improvements.

items.title: Precision Link Conveyor Is Fast, Accurate
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)

items.title: Toyota Ranks No. 1 Among Automotive Suppliers
items.author: Jennifer Pierce
items.summary:
- *Toyota*, *Honda*, and *General Motors* lead the automotive industry as the most favorable OEMs according to a recent study by Plante Moran.
- Despite challenges such as material costs and declining demand for electric vehicles, five out of six OEMs showed improved supplier relations.
- The ranking emphasizes ongoing efforts by manufacturers to strengthen partnerships amidst industry tensions.

items.title: Rolls-Royce Invests $75 Million in South Carolina Plant
GEM Gravure
items.summary:
- **GEM Gravure** specializes in solving marking and coding challenges for manufacturers globally.
- Their advanced inks and printers create *durable* and *reliable marks* on tough substrates.
- They focus on building *lasting partnerships* and providing solutions for various industries, from automotive to industrial.

items.title: Fusion Inc. - Automating Brazing Processes
items.summary:
- Fusion Inc. specializes in automating *brazing* and *soldering* with over 60 years of expertise.
- The company provides custom-built systems combining **precision paste alloys**, advanced applicator equipment, and cutting-edge automation.
- Fusion aims to streamline operations for *maximum efficiency* and performance in the manufacturing process.

items.title: Design Tool, Inc.
items.summary:
- *Design Tool, Inc.* specializes in **automatic screw feeding and driving** technology.
- With a team boasting *85 years of experience*, they offer solutions for various industries in North Carolina.
- The company has sold over *30,000 machines* worldwide for human operation, machine components, and robotic systems.

items.title: Demco Automation
items.summary:
- *Demco Automation* develops and implements custom automated manufacturing systems tailored to specific applications.
- Their services include **Assembly Systems**, **Robotics**, **Tooling**, **Material Handling**, and **Process Development**.
- The company aims to provide ongoing value and maximum flexibility in the manufacturing process, adapting to market changes.

items.title: Creform Corp.
items.summary:
- *Creform* provides innovative solutions for *dynamic material handling* in manufacturing. 
- Their expertise in adaptive systems supports *continuous improvement methodologies* such as *Kaizen* and *lean manufacturing*. 
- With over *700 components* and three decades of experience, Creform optimizes efficiency through various technologies including *AGVs* and *gravity roller conveyors*.

items.title: COVAL Vacuum Technology, Inc.
items.summary:
- COVAL is a leader in *vacuum automation solutions* across various industries. 
- They specialize in high-performance *suction cups*, vacuum generators, and robotic grippers designed for efficiency. 
- COVAL's products enhance productivity and support *sustainable operations* in automation systems.

items.title: BalTec Corp Overview
items.summary:
- BalTec Group specializes in *joining technology machinery*, focusing on *radial riveting*, *orbital riveting*, and *roller forming*.
- Established in 1968, BalTec has become a **global leader** with over 70 employees and 40 sales partners worldwide.
- They also offer **custom turnkey work cells** to address clients' specific integration needs.

items.title: Cobot Boosts Productivity at Contract Manufacturer
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- Action Plastics enhanced productivity by introducing a *cobot*, specifically the OB7, to automate repetitive tasks.
- The cobot significantly improved *quality control* in assembly processes for customers, ensuring consistent results and optimizing throughput.
- This automation allows employees to focus on more skilled tasks, reshaping the workplace into a more *dynamic* environment.

items.title: GM Profit Falls Amid Tariff Costs Despite EV Gains
items.summary:
- GM's profit dropped by **34%** in Q2 due to over **$1 billion** in tariff costs.  
- Despite challenges, **EV sales more than doubled**, with GM capturing **16%** of the U.S. EV market.  
- The company plans to invest **$4 billion** in U.S. production while also facing pressure from **domestic and international** competition.

items.title: Vision Systems Automate Inspection of EV Components
items.summary:
- *BorgWarner* leverages advanced machine vision technology for *precision assembly* and inspection of EV components.
- Automated inspection processes enhance quality control, delegating human effort more efficiently.
- The *Cognex 3D vision system* significantly improves defect detection and is crucial for maintaining safety standards in EV manufacturing.

items.title: Modular Automated Cell Assembles Medical Devices
items.summary:
- **Mikron Automation** has launched a modular, *semiautomatic assembly cell* for medical devices.
- This scalable system allows for rapid deployment with low investment, functioning effectively in an *ISO 7 clean room*.
- Up to **12 cells** can be linked for increased production capacity, running at rates of *up to 5 cycles per minute*.

items.title: Pratt & Whitney Celebrates 100 Years
items.summary:
- *Pratt & Whitney* marks a century of innovation in the *aerospace industry*, having introduced significant technologies like the *R-1340 Wasp engine*.
- The company continues to lead with its *GTF™ engines* and the *F135 engine* for the F-35, emphasizing efficiency and safety.
- Celebratory events include a *global exhibit* at 11 sites and a historical marker at its original headquarters in *Hartford, Connecticut*.

items.title: New Silicone Bonding Method Could Strengthen Soft Robots and Medical Devices
items.summary:
- Research from the University of Hawaiʻi has developed a method to enhance *silicone elastomers*, crucial for soft medical devices and robotics.
- By controlling *curing time and temperature*, the bonding strength of silicone layers can be significantly improved, achieving a 50% increase in flexibility.
- This approach is *simple and scalable*, promising advancements in *healthcare, robotics*, and *consumer technology*.
